Save the Cat.Opening Image: Miles Morales navigates life between two worlds — his elite boarding school and his Brooklyn roots. He's bright, creative, and disconnected, setting the stage for a coming-of-age transformation.
Save the Cat.Theme Stated: Peter Parker’s voiceover and Miles’ graffiti art reflect the core message: 'Anyone can wear the mask.' This is a story about identity, responsibility, and finding one’s place.
Save the Cat.Set-Up: Miles’ relationship with his father and uncle is established, highlighting different influences. A mysterious spider bite begins to alter his perception — and his DNA.
Save the Cat.Catalyst: Miles witnesses Peter Parker’s death and is entrusted with a device that can stop Kingpin's collider. The world loses a hero — and Miles inherits a burden he doesn’t feel ready for.
Save the Cat.Debate: Haunted by doubt, Miles questions his worth. He meets alternate Spider-heroes who challenge and inspire him, but also doubt his readiness.
Save the Cat.Break into Two: Despite fear and inexperience, Miles joins the mission. He must train with Peter B. Parker and learn what it means to become Spider-Man.
Save the Cat.B Story: Peter B. Parker acts as an unlikely mentor. Their dynamic — gruff veteran and wide-eyed rookie — evolves into mutual growth and emotional resonance.
Save the Cat.Fun and Games: Training montages, stealth missions, awkward webslinging, and humorous multiverse hijinks build the world’s tone and Miles’ internal struggle.
Save the Cat.Midpoint: After being tied up by his friends for his own safety, Miles has a breakthrough. He internalizes the belief that he must take control of his fate — alone.
Save the Cat.Bad Guys Close In: Kingpin’s plan accelerates. The collider threatens to destroy all dimensions. Miles’ confidence is tested as his family becomes a target.
Save the Cat.All Is Lost: His uncle Aaron — revealed as the Prowler — is killed protecting him. Miles is left grieving, feeling unready, abandoned by the other Spider-heroes.
Save the Cat.Dark Night of the Soul: With advice from his father and memory of his uncle, Miles reflects on what makes a hero. He realizes that self-belief is the missing piece.
Save the Cat.Break into Three: Miles designs his own suit, masters his powers, and joins the final mission. He steps into the Spider-Man identity with clarity and style.
Save the Cat.Finale: Miles defeats Kingpin with ingenuity and heart. He helps the others return home and protects his city — on his own terms.
Save the Cat.Final Image: Miles swings confidently through Brooklyn, embracing his identity. He’s no longer in Peter’s shadow — he’s his own Spider-Man.

Hero’s Journey.Ordinary World: Miles is a gifted teen struggling to fit into his new school and balance expectations from his family.
Hero’s Journey.Call to Adventure: After being bitten by a radioactive spider and witnessing Spider-Man’s death, Miles inherits a cosmic responsibility.
Hero’s Journey.Trials: He trains with alternate Spider-heroes, confronts villains, and grapples with loss and fear. Each challenge pushes him closer to self-realization.
Hero’s Journey.Ordeal: Miles is forced to face his greatest fear — that he isn’t ready. But through introspection and support, he claims his power.
Hero’s Journey.Return: He emerges as a confident, capable Spider-Man, ready to protect his world and carry the legacy forward.

Story Circle.You: Miles is a bright, self-doubting teen caught between expectation and self-expression.
Story Circle.Need: He yearns to live up to the Spider-Man legacy, but needs to believe in himself and embrace his own version of heroism.
Story Circle.Go: After a spider bite and witnessing Peter Parker’s death, he’s pulled into a multiverse mission with alternate Spider-heroes.
Story Circle.Search: He trains awkwardly, faces skepticism, and struggles to control his powers while navigating grief and pressure.
Story Circle.Find: Through personal loss and hard-earned insight, he discovers his strength and what makes him unique.
Story Circle.Take: He loses his uncle and is rejected by the team, forcing him to stand alone and confront his deepest fears.
Story Circle.Return: Miles creates his own suit, refines his abilities, and joins the final battle with full confidence.
Story Circle.Change: He emerges as a true Spider-Man — grounded in self-belief, compassion, and a distinct sense of identity.
